statement: The Company declared a dividend of ₹ 4 per equity share for FY2022.
Bajaj Finserv continues to be one of the most efficient users of capital among private sector insurance companies.
In FY2022, BHFL earned total income of ₹ 3,767 crore and profit after tax of ₹ 710 crore.
The Board of Directors has recommended a dividend of ₹ 4 per equity share for FY2022 for the approval of members.
BFL continues to be the dominant lender for consumer electronics, financing 12.7 million purchases in FY2022.
BFL's assets under management increased by 29% to ₹ 197,452 crore.
BFS Group strives to influence its value chain partners to participate in responsible and sustainable business conduct.
The Group has trained about 17,800 Debt Recovery Agents.
BFS and its subsidiaries have zero tolerance towards unethical business practices.
The Group has invested `1.14 crore for rooftop solar plant installations at certain offices during the year.
Corporate offices of the Group companies have ramps for easy movement and wheelchair accessible restrooms for specially abled people.
BFS Group trains its employees on safety protocols by conducting periodic trainings on fire safety and evacuation drills.
All Group companies extend various support and compensatory packages in the event of death of permanent employees.
The Group has received green, disposable and recycling certificates from the respective e-waste handlers.
The Company faced challenges due to the Covid-19 pandemic, which impacted its operations.

The general insurance industry faced a difficult environment amid the resurgence of the Covid pandemic.
